label.name: This data is simulated data which gives the yields...
label.intro:
This data is simulated data which gives the yields of millet in West Africa. Your task is to decide what you want to find out from this data.

The data set has nine variables.

There are three treatments: 

  • Variety (Variete) - The first of three treatments. This is the variety that the Millet was in, either Locale or ICRI.

  • Zai - The second of three treatments. This is whether ZAI was used (Yes is "Oui", or No is "Non"). Zai is a farming technique where pits are dug in the soil during the preseason to catch water and concentrate any compost added. It is traditionally used in western Sahel (Burkina Faso, Niger, Mali). A video is on it here: https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/2/23/Zai_in_Batodi.webm

  • Weeding (Desherbage) - The final of three treatments, this is the weeding technique. There are two levels - Ameliore and Normal.

Each treatment had two levels, leading eight treatment combinations.

The other factors in the data are structural: 

  • Year (Annee) – the trial is repeated over two years in 2017 and 2018.
  • Gender (Type de Producteur) – this study was trying to understand how men and women's fields are different.
  • Region (Region) – this was done in specific communities within three different regions.
  • Soil (Sol) – all regions have a broad categorisation of their soil. Both soil types are represented within each community.
  • Farm (Essaie) – within each community, this is the replication number for the farm.
  • Plot (Parcelle) – The nature of the experimental design was for each farm to have six plots.

The final variable is the yield (Rendement)


There are 1140 different combinations in total between the factors (including the treatments). The number of replications changes the size of the data set. There are three data sets: Small (10 replications), Medium (100 replications), and Large (1000 replications).

The task here is to conceptualise and think through what you are going to try and find out from this data.
